Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is unclear how well the product works, how well it will be received, and when it will be available to the public. There is also mention of the need for clinical trials and other certifications before it can be released on the market.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the new male contraception product will effectively allow men to control the flow of sperm by flicking a switch. However, it is unclear how well the product works and if it will be successful in achieving this.
Exist alternative explanation: Some experts are skeptical about the device, suggesting that there may be alternative explanations or concerns regarding its effectiveness and safety.
